We are extremely proud to announce that even through the complexities of distance learning our Tiger spirit and drive has remained strong, and our Visual Arts Society has risen to the challenge! THE 2020 National CELEBRATING ART CONTEST, results are in: FIVE of our own fantastic Valley View HS Student Artists have made it past thousands of competitors to make their way into THE TOP 25% IN THE NATION! This makes FOUR CONSECUTIVE YEARS that our artists have been selected from a multitude of talent from charter, public and private schools from around the nation!

A huge CONGRATULATIONS goes out to Mrs. Cecilia Valdez and her Visual Arts students for these amazing accomplishments!! Way to go, and GO TIGERS!!

THESE TALENTED STUDENTS ARE:

Senior--- Bertha Alanis

Senior--- Valeria Arrambide

Senior--- Zachary Arellano

Sophomore—Kayla Barrera

And Sophomore--- Azul Sosa

This is a very exciting honor because along with this national recognition, their artwork is now set for publication in the Fall of 2020!

We would like to thank Hidalgo County Pct. 2 Commissioner Eduardo " Eddie" Cantu, Capable Kids Foundation, Inc, and everyone that was present today at the ribbon cutting ceremony for the first all-inclusive park in Hidalgo County.

The park includes fully accessible swings, gliders, merry go rounds, sensory walls, roller slides, and a splash pad for all children including kids with special needs who require proper wheelchair access and/or equipment.

The park will be open to the public Monday - Friday 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We hope everyone enjoys the park.

post_text: Our Valley View ISD Board of Trustees was recognized on September 29, 2018, as a Regional Honor Board of Texas. One of only 16 school boards across the entire state of Texas to receive this prestigious state award! Each year, the Texas Association of School Administrators (TASA) recognizes school boards for their dedication and ethical service. As this year's recipients of the Regional Honor Board Award, the state is taking notice that our Board of Trustees is making a positive impact on our entire district - students, schools, and their community. Our Tiger Country is grateful and fortunate to have such an extraordinary leadership team worthy of state recognition. Thank you Valley View ISD School Board for volunteering your time as you give our district your outstanding service each and every day of the school year.
